newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian OLOs at session lows, spread could narrow.
newsitem.headline: Belgian OLOs at session lows, spread could narrow.

text.p: Belgian OLOs sank to the day's lows by late afternoon after unsurprising U.S. inflation data.

Dealers expected the yield spread of 10-year OLOs over equivalent Bunds to narrow if markets staged a more significant downward correction. "I don't see the spread going above 15, and if there's a downside correction it could even go flat," one said.
The spread - which last week hit a record 4.5 basis points - edged out one bp to eight. A month ago it was still at 22.
By 1410 GMT the 2006 benchmark OLO yielded 6.11 percent, up from 6.06 at the previous close.

December bond futures fell 31 basis points to hit 119.30, after peaking in early trading at 119.79. Prices had staged a brief rally from lows amid relief after the U.S. consumer prices rose by 0.3 percent in September, exactly as expected.
Other dealers said Bunds and U.S. Treasuries would continue to dictate the OLO market trend as Belgian bonds seemed happy to ignore domestic issues for now.

These included social unrest -- aimed at the judicial powers -- over the investigation into a paedophile and murder scandal and a controversial currency swaps operation dogging Finance Minister Philippe Maystadt. -- Lorrayne Smith, Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6812, Fax +32 2 230 7710
